div.p: RB MSS M number, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens, Melbourne.

Yesterday we celebrated your wedding day by driving to Castle Maddie 12 miles for some things delivered there for us, among them a box of toys from uncle Ferd for the children to decorate the Xmas table. As we do not know where we shall then be, we have given Georgie his cart & horse & a ball at once; for your little girls is here a doll in a nightdress, a little teaservice white & gold, a lead dinner service & some tin figures in a box for Ted.

Georgie is such a tidy child, when he is done playing he put his toys in a box, & when he comes in gives me his hat to hang up. I asked him: what shall I write to Tante. he said Brief (Letter). What did you see Georgie? "Kueruh" (Kangaroo) Joe, Hans, Women give milk, Tommy, Mary (Blackfellows) Bush. — The doll he will not touch on any account, he says "Mama arm Baby cries, hungry, he says to my glove how do .
Charles has at last visited us for a few days, we could not give him much pleasure, the weather was unfavourable.—
